poem:
In the wake of conflict

Beirut's breath,
a thread unwound,
Ibrahim's shadow lingers—
a memory in rubble,
fingers trace the skyline,
years of combat fold,
his name,
a whisper in sand,
lost to the pulse
of a city dawn.
